summary: The document is a form associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, detailing procedures for the handling of index card reproductions, including their editing, consolidation, or destruction based on specific criteria. It also references Ke One Roman Fedorovich DEDKOV and his wife Vilasa Nikolayevna DEDKOV, who sought entry visas to India in the early 1960s, with Roman slated to teach English at the Soviet Embassy in New Delhi, though his actual arrival there remains unconfirmed.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It contains detailed instructions for handling and processing index card reproductions for record consolidation or destruction.
Mentions two individuals, Roman and Vilasa DEDKOV, who applied for visas to India in the early 1960s, with Roman intended to teach English at the Soviet Embassy in New Delhi.
The actual arrival of Roman DEDKOV in New Delhi is noted as unknown.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
